title: Sondland Told House Panels Trump's Ukraine Pressure Was Quid Pro Quo
summary: U.S. envoy to EU told House committees that he believed White House meeting was conditioned on Ukraine opening investigations, his lawyer says. WASHINGTON-A top U.S. diplomat told House committees last week that efforts by President Trump and his allies to press Kyiv to open investigations in exchange for a White House meeting with Ukraine's president amounted to a quid pro quo, his lawyer said.

title: PG&E Expands Power Shut-Offs in California
summary: Severe windstorm advances on region, prompting new evacuation orders amid heightened risk of wildfire. SAN FRANCISCO- PG&E Corp. was shutting off power to significantly more customers in Northern and Central California than previously announced, as a severe windstorm advanced on the region and prompted new evacuation orders amid heightened risk of wildfire.

title: Pompeo Discussed Senate Race in Kansas With Koch
summary: Secretary of State talked to billionaire Charles Koch during a visit to Wichita. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo discussed the U.S. Senate race in Kansas with billionaire Charles Koch and a top official from his namesake company during a visit to Wichita on Friday, according to a person familiar with the meeting.

title: Chile's President Calls on Cabinet to Resign After Large-Scale Protest
summary: Subway fare increase sparked days of protest and rioting and led to curfews and a state of emergency. SANTIAGO, Chile-Chilean President Sebastián Piñera on Saturday called for his entire cabinet to step down, one day after more than a million people took to the streets in the capital of Santiago to protest inequality and the high cost of living in the Andean nation.

title: 'Edison' Review: The Invention of Modernity
summary: The writer who gave us a masterly biography of Theodore Roosevelt found, for his final work, an equally compelling subject in the oddball genius whose discoveries continue to light our world.. In October 1929, Thomas Edison was a sleep-deprived octogenarian, deaf as an adder-"I haven't heard a bird sing since I was twelve years old." Having sworn off public speaking, he was reluctant to break his silence for Light's Golden Jubilee, a slickly packaged commemoration of the 50th anniversary of his incandescent light bulb. Yet he could hardly say no when Henry Ford, a fervent admirer, asked him to re-enact the moment of discovery at Greenfield Village-more formally christened the Edison Institute-in Dearborn, Mich. Prominent in Ford's outdoor museum of historic structures was the relocated New Jersey laboratory in which a carbon-filament bulb of hand-blown glass had burned without interruption for 131/2 hours on the night of Oct. 21-22, 1879.

title: U.S. Sends Forces to Protect Syrian Oil Fields
summary: The move marks a shift from President Trump's decision to pull most troops from the country. The U.S. military sent fresh forces on Saturday to secure oil fields in eastern Syria, two U.S. officials said, as part of a pivot from a decision earlier this month to pull most American troops out of the country.

title: Former Bolton Deputy Files Lawsuit Over Impeachment Inquiry Subpoena
summary: Charles Kupperman asks federal court to rule on whether he must testify in the House impeachment inquiry. WASHINGTON-President Trump's former deputy national security officer asked a federal judge late Friday to rule on whether he must testify in the House's impeachment inquiry, setting up a test of White House claims of immunity for the president's closest advisers.

title: Bruce Springsteen Exhibit Is a Town's Claim to His Legacy
summary: Resume Subscription. Big things often come from small towns. That's certainly the case for Freehold, N.J., the hometown of Bruce Springsteen.

title: What to Expect When You're Expecting Less Inflation
summary: Inflation expectations are sinking, which could make Fed's job harder. Hardly anybody expects much in the way of inflation anymore. That is a big problem for the Federal Reserve.

title: After New York Rent Reform, Some Landlords Are Falling Behind
summary: Emerald Equity Group, Sugar Hill Capital Partners have missed loan payments on Upper Manhattan rental properties. Two New York landlords with large portfolios of rent-regulated apartments are behind on payments on more than $200 million in real-estate loans, a sign that new state rent laws are starting to hurt investors.

title: These Moms Got on TikTok to Understand Their Kids. Then....They Stayed.
summary: A thriving community of single moms is using teen video app TikTok to celebrate their divorces, grieve their losses and even discipline their kids. As soon as Jamie Garrison signed her divorce papers, she turned up the Spice Girls.

title: Financial Industry Leads the Way on Diversity
summary: Banks and insurers got the highest overall score in The Wall Street Journal rankings. The financial industry, once seen as a stronghold of older, mostly white men, now leads the S&P 500 index in terms of overall workforce diversity.

title: How the WSJ Research Analysts' Diversity and Inclusion Rankings Were Compiled
summary: Methodology for the first diversity study by the WSJ environment, social and governance research analysts. The Wall Street Journal environment, social and governance research analysts rated the S&P 500 companies on 10 individual performance indicators. The six main categories analyzed in this research are:

title: The Business Case for More Diversity
summary: Resume Subscription. Diverse and inclusive cultures are providing companies with a competitive edge over their peers.

title: PepsiCo Puts Military Veterans to Work
summary: The food and beverage maker says it seeks out former service members for their leadership skills. Before landing her first job managing a Frito-Lay factory that churned out Cheetos and Funyuns, Toby Johnson flew an Apache helicopter during the invasion of Iraq.

title: Companies Falter in Making Diversity and Inclusion a C-Suite Job
summary: D&I usually falls under human resources, but a handful of corporations are dedicating a top executive to the task. When Dow Inc. named Karen S. Carter as chief inclusion officer in 2017, the chemical company became only the fifth member of the S&P 500 to elevate such a role to the C-suite. That group hasn't grown since.

title: Why Starbucks Expanded Its Transgender Health Benefits
summary: Resume Subscription. Seven years ago, Tate Buhrmester made the decision to come out as transgender while working as a supervisor at a Starbucks Corp. store in Austin, Texas.

title: What's Holding Companies Back From Expanding Diversity
summary: Among the challenges: creating a more diverse pipeline and measuring the extent of the problem. Much has been said about the importance of having a diverse and inclusive workforce, yet when it comes to promoting ethnically and racially diverse people to boards and senior leadership positions, U.S. companies continue to struggle.

title: How Microsoft Tapped the Autism Community for Talent
summary: To attract job candidates with autism, the software giant had to alter its hiring process. That included eliminating the initial phone screening.. Before landing his dream job as a data scientist at Microsoft Corp. , Joey Chemis, who holds degrees in comprehensive math, discrete math and algorithms and statistics, had a hard time finding a job.

title: In Debut Before High Court, Ginsburg Got Only So-So Marks From One Justice
summary: Harry Blackmun graded the attorneys who came before the high court-and he was no pushover. Ruth Bader Ginsburg is a revered Supreme Court justice who spent her early legal career fighting for women's rights. But one justice gave her original performance before the high court only passing marks.

title: The Struggle to Hire More Minority Engineers
summary: Resume Subscription. After seeing an artificial heart on a 1980s television show, Telva McGruder started thinking she might want to become an engineer.

title: After an Alzheimer's Diagnosis, Friends Stop Calling
summary: Resume Subscription. When Keith Moreland, 58, was diagnosed in the early stages of Alzheimer's in 2018, he noticed that friends stopped including him and his wife, Sheri, on outings.

title: Astros Finally Deliver the Big Hits in the World Series
summary: Houston gets a 4-1 win in Game 3, but Washington still leads the best-of-seven matchup two games to one.. WASHINGTON-The 1,200 mile plane ride from Houston to Washington takes about 2 1/2 hours. With their championship aspirations hanging in the balance, the Houston Astros' journey earlier this week felt much longer.

title: 'James Tissot: Fashion & Faith' Review: More Than Pretty People?
summary: Tissot, often dismissed as a society painter, gets a reappraisal at San Francisco's Legion of Honor..

title: New York Regulator Probes UnitedHealth Algorithm for Racial Bias
summary: Financial Services Department is investigating whether algorithm violates state antidiscrimination law. New York's insurance regulator said it is launching an investigation into a UnitedHealth Group Inc. algorithm that a study found prioritized care for healthier white patients over sicker black patients.

title: SoftBank's WeWork Bailout Draws Investor Concern
summary: Conglomerate plans to spend nearly $10 billion to rescue floundering office-share company. Investors and credit-rating firms are growing concerned about rising risks and weak controls at SoftBank Group Corp. after the Japanese conglomerate's nearly $10 billion bailout of WeWork.

title: Stripped, Beaten and Burned: Egypt Accused of Using Torture
summary: Resume Subscription. Egyptian security officers grabbed Esraa Abdel Fattah from her car in the country's capital on Oct. 12, then blindfolded the political activist and took her to a security facility.

title: Whose Advice Are You Taking? The Fight Over College Counseling at Elite High Schools
summary: In the first application season since the cheating scandal, schools weigh how to exert control. At Harvard-Westlake School in Los Angeles, families receive a 43-page handbook on college planning. Students meet with their counselors, known as deans, sophomore year to discuss course selection and extracurriculars. Spring of junior year, they begin college counseling meetings, bringing parents along to some. Summer before senior year, the school hosts college essay-writing workshops.

title: Blackstone's Online-Shopping Play: Warehouses
summary: Resume Subscription. Blackstone Group Inc. is betting that the rise of online shopping will remain a bright spot in the face of slowing global economic growth. But it isn't buying retailers. It's buying warehouses.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription.

title: What Matters This Week in the 2020 Race
summary: Whether for presidential or campaign business, Trump is getting to states important for re-election. When President Trump traveled to Pittsburgh this week for a speech to a friendly audience, he attracted media attention mostly because of a head-scratching passage in which he declared that his administration was building a border wall in Colorado, which happens to abut New Mexico rather than Mexico.

title: Using Horsepower to Fight PTSD and Veteran Suicide
summary: Meggan Hill-McQueeney, the president of BraveHearts, is an ardent advocate for the benefits of therapeutic riding, also known as equine therapy. Meggan Hill-McQueeney, a lifelong equestrian, first witnessed the healing power of horses while working after college on a ranch in Colorado, where she was teaching people to ride. A family had brought their 4-year-old son, a boy with Down syndrome who was uncommunicative. Something about the horse captivated him. Sitting in the saddle, he signed "horse"-the first word he had ever communicated. His mother started crying, which prompted his first spoken word too: "Mama."

title: Tech Giants Have Hijacked the Web. It's Time for a Reboot.
summary: While Washington looks to combat online monopolies, some innovators are developing new internet platforms to prevent monopolies from forming in the future. Facebook co-founder Mark Zuckerberg said, in a speech last week at Georgetown University, that his social media megacorp and its Big Tech peers "have decentralized power by putting it directly into people's hands."
